Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Disny
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only 03 days. I booked triple/family room online. It was spacious, clean and tidy. And also rooms cleaned every day and clean towels given daily. They provide Tea/coffee and mineral water in room. Iron, hair dryer and iron table available on your request. The hotel is very close to the MRT/bus and for shopping malls on walking distance. You get plenty of food outlets and Mustafa centre is very close by. I do recommend this hotel for families who would look for a hotel in Singapore. No free WiFi/ Internet. Wifi/Internet charges bit expensive than the outside. You can find reasonable places nearby than the hotel. Staff were not very friendly, their busy with their own work but supportive. And not very strict with check in. I was able to check in around 9.30 a.m.(depend on the availability)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and affordable”
Reviews.Author: summertime88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. I booked triple room and it was very spacious for singapore hotels standard, especially for the price you pay. The room i stayed had just been renovated, so it was nice, clean and new, the only downside was the room had no window. So make sure you request a room with window if you want. The location also very great, you only have to cross the street to get to the mall and MRT. 7-11 on walking distance, food court just across the street. Very recommended hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Travellerporirua
Reviews.Content: Singapore hotels are uysually very expensive to stay. But this Hotel with fair size room is clean and tidy. Very helpful staff. Rooms cleaned and linen/towels changed every day. Ideally located in Little India with Mustafa shopping 24/7 and several 24/7 eateries in this neighbourhood. It is still in the red light area but no hassles at all. The rooms facing Kitchener road can be noisy even at midnight with some goons riding noisy motobikes at high speed even after 2:00am as windows are not double glazed. Double rooms S$110 nett/Family rooms S$130 nett.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel fot its value”
Reviews.Author: chiragu
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice for about 3 nights each time and once it was with my family. let me tell you it’s a good hotel in 2010 it was a bit messy because of ageing but now as it is recently renovated it is great, clean and big rooms bigger than many budget hotels in Singapore cost wise very effective only 110 SGD nett they provide package water and tea and coffee in room. Iron table and iron is available on request. What else a person needs in 110 SGD. I had a pretty pleasant stay and also enjoyed its location very near MRT and Mustafa shopping mall. There are plenty of Indian restaurants nearby. I would recommend everyone who would want to stay In a budgeted hotel please chose Tai hoe. Great Price, location, experience..

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: lunathique
Reviews.Content: I was staying at Tai Hoe for 3 nights, unfortunately during their renovation time. They were renovating some floors above mine (I was on 2nd floor) on 9am-6pm. The great thing about this hotel is the convenient location. It's within walking distance to Mustafa Centre, lots of food hawkers around, City Square Mall, and to Farrer Park MRT station. They don't provide breakfast, but they provide instant coffee and teh tarik in every room. No toiletries, only towels and tissue every day. Room itself was not sparkling clean, but overall it was ok. No bed bugs or smelly odors. You have to pay for wi-fi, and the connection sucks. My room was at the farthest corner and to get a connection I need to stand in front of my door. There are some computers you can use down in the lobby though.

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly big and cheap”
Reviews.Author: Rakesh37
Reviews.Content: At the rate being offered and considering the location, I would rate this hotel the best deal for budget travellers. Room sizes are pretty big overlooking city with a min fridge and a very small TV showing only 5-7 free to air channels. rooms do have a wardrobe Bathrooms are pretty small. No restaurant in house but there are plenty in the vicinity and a big mall just across the road. Mustafa Center is in the next block so the hotel will keep you busy 24 X 7 Well connected by bus and MRT

Reviews.Title: “will stay in another hotel next time”
Reviews.Author: explore_galore
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just recommended to us by my friend since she lives nearby the hotel. Outside, it looks okay, being near the malls, train stations and other stores... but inside, it wasn't good at all! The lobby was so small and lots of luggages (maybe from other hotel guests) were just lying near the elevator! There wasn't even any staff to greet you or open the door for you. Only the receptionist who is so preoccupied with a lot of things. When we got to our room, beds were a bit hard. The room was not at all inviting! The bathroom was so dirty! Molds and fungi have been building up on the tiles! It was totally disgusting. If you operate a hotel, at least maintain it so that people will come back . I understand that the price is cheaper than the normal hotels in Singapore, but at least, give the visitors something to appreciate!

Reviews.Title: “dingy, unsafe, poor service”
Reviews.Author: disherwood
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel at S$85, it seemed like a bargain compared to other hotels, but when I arrived I realized that S$85 was actually the (recently raised) rack rate, and sure enough the room itself was less than half that value: very shabby and bedbug-ridden, with hardly any of the normal service. The staff were gruff to the point of rudeness. Towards the end of my three-day stay I began to feel insecure about my possessions. I have been to over a hundred hotels and never felt like that. I escaped to a Hotel 81 and it was small and simple and nothing special but very professionally run compared to this place. I think even a hostel like Checkers would have been a better choice than Tai Hoe. In Singapore the cheap hotels are generally in Little India and Geylang. Little India is quite an insular Indian community, and Geylang is quite an insular Chinese community. I would have a preference for staying in the center of town where English is well tolerated, even though it's a bit more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, budget option”
Reviews.Author: quarryking
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on a work trip. Hotel was chosen based on close proximity to our work spot and it's pricing. Nothing fancy and all very basic & functional.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better.”
Reviews.Author: pras78
Reviews.Content: Tai Hoe was our choice for stay in singapore because it was it is located in Little India. Me , wife and daughter were on a leisure trip. Bit overpriced but worth the deal. Dont expect too much. Pros. 1. Right in little India. 2. Proximity to Farrer Park station. (very close) 3. Descently clean 4. Complementary tea coffee and mineral water. 5. Hot and cold water available. 6. AC was good 7. Very good proximity to Indian food outlets(decent),. Mustafa shopping Mall, Currency exchange. etc. Cons.1. No breakfast in the tarriff 2. Ambience in lobby could be alittle better. 3. Hot water for tea and coffee from lobby was availabe. Not water heater/ boiler for tea coffee in Room 4. Interiors need rejuvenation.

Reviews.Title: “NEAT & ECONOMICAL STAY”
Reviews.Author: SREERAJA
Reviews.Content: this hotel is centrally located in singapore. very close to the shopping landmark of the never sleeping city " mustafa shopping centre ". you can find all kinds of restaurants and spas around this area. you get taxis in front of this hotel at anytime. the mrt is just 4 minutes walking distance from the hotel. if you need a room just for a 3 or 4 hours too, you can hire one and freshen up and proceed. i would recommend business travellers to try this hotel but i wouldn't recommend to families because of the absense of room service of food, jucies, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean & Confortable stay”
Reviews.Author: ahm2001bd
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel several times. I found its very clean. Service is good. Its near Mustafa Shopping is just 1 min walking distance, any time shopping can be done as Mustafa is 24h open. rates are also good & reasonable compare to other hotel in this place. But its much better n comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid under any circumstances”
Reviews.Author: Bandekar
Reviews.Content: I had to go to singapore in an emergency, so coudn't get any other place to stay. The travel agent said its a nice small cosy hotel so give it try. The experience was so terrible I will not recommend it to any one. The room were extremely dingy, and had very weared out look. The upholstery, the bed sheets, etc, had a dusty feel. The bath room (it was so small, can't call it a room) was the smallest I have ever seen. Room service was almost non existent.

HotelInfo.Name: Tai Hoe
HotelInfo.Address: 163 Kitchener Road, Singapore, Singapore
